action_title: Cut/mow and rotovate to control grass
key_messages:
Key Messages:

One controlled study in the UKÂ found that mowing followed by rotovating increased the number of heathland plant species in one of two sites. The same study found that the presence of a minority of heathland and non-heathland species increased.
background_information:
Background information and definitions:
Mowing reduces the length of vegetation and when combined with rotovation it may create areas of bare earth where shrubland plant species can establish.
